meanings.definition: A plant of the daisy family with bright blue flowers.
meanings.sent1: The chicory in the garden had lovely blue petals.
meanings.sent2: The chicory plant added a pop of color to the field.
meanings.sent3: The chicory flowers seemed to be waving hello in the breeze.
meanings.sent4: The chicory stood out like a sapphire in the sea of green.
meanings.sent5: The bright blue chicory blooms were a sight to behold.

meanings.definition: A bitter-tasting plant used in salads and as a coffee substitute.
meanings.sent1: The salad had a hint of chicory that made it taste unique.
meanings.sent2: Some people enjoy the bitterness of chicory in their coffee.
meanings.sent3: The chicory in the salad puckered my lips with its bitterness.
meanings.sent4: Her coffee was as dark and bitter as chicory on a winter morning.
meanings.sent5: The chicory added a bold flavor to the salad, making it unforgettable.
